content: We cannot detect why it is spam. I did a quick search engine check for some third-party tools (there are many) . I copied URLs of a few that I share here. Spam can be due to bad IP address, insecure setup of server (DKIM and SPF records(, and often relaying (using one email address for message and another one for SMTP). These may help: https://inboxlane.com/email-spam-test.php https://mxtoolbox.com/blacklists.aspx https://mailchecker.net/

creator: siffemoz

content:
Have you contacted you email provider (the company that have their name in your email address after the @)

Thunderbird does not and can not bounce emails. I think there might be an addon that some folk install to allow them to pretend their server bounced the email. But a check of the headers makes the add-ons ruse obvious. So if your emails are truly being bounced it will be an issue with the server. Quite possibly your account is full. It is something that can come to bite folk that use IMAP accounts as all the mail stays on the server until you delete it and in some cases also empty the trash. While some providers allow for terabytes to be used storing your mail, internet service providers rarely are very generousness with their storage space of email. So the space fills quite quickly.
creator: MattAuSupport

Jane

content:
Come fare un backup è spiegato qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

content:
If you want to move all accounts, settings, and messages it's easiest to just transfer the full profile.

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If you just want to move some messages, I suggest exiting thunderbird and copying message folders (ignoring the msf entries) from within profile folder and pasting in the Mail\Local Folders folder of the receiving PC. If you need more detail, let me know.
creator: davidsk

What exactly have you connected to Strato, is it email domain of hosted wordpress? What domain is the email on? is The DNS for the domain setup for email with an MX record and DKIM, SPF etc. Has it had time to propagate? new domains are far from instantaneous.

Most of the folk I have seen here over the years making noises like you are have signed up for something other that a full hosting deal, or have not configured DNS for the domains email.

I am not even going to try and answer you questions because I am over guessing without relevant information, but you might want to disable the experimental new account hub in settings and see if that has an impact. Search experimental in settings to find it.

content:
OK, when transferring to new computer, here are the steps that work 100% if followed carefully:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If you already have thunderbird installed and accounts set up and have local folders to transfer, it's really only a matter of cutting and pasting. If you're comfortable with windows file explorer, a quick solution is this:

- click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to profile folder and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird. - you are now in the profile. note the exact location on hard drive. - click the Mail folder and then the Local Folder - this is where you want to paste the old local folders - remember the location - now, locate the Mail\Local Folders on backup. it may be accessible at users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profilename> (The name of the profile is in the text file named profiles.ini within the thunderbird folder) locate the Mail\Local Folders folder and copy everything there and paste into the above referenced place

If you would like more assistance, just let me know. I encourage saving the above mentioned steps for transfering to other computers. Those steps are also good for periodic backups (the first four steps) which I suggest doing periodically.
creator: davidsk

Are you talking about the send later shortcut perhaps?

Send now is Ctrl+Enter and send later is Ctrl+Shift+Enter

There is no button for send later as such, but send becomes a send later button if you place Thunderbird in offline mode. (click the ((0)) at the bottom of the main screen on the left.)
